metadata.Title: CVE-2023-40359 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
xterm before 380 supports ReGIS reporting for character-set names even if they have unexpected characters (i.e., neither alphanumeric nor underscore), aka a pointer/overflow issue. This can only occur for xterm installations that are configured at compile time to use a certain experimental feature.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-40359` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

xterm - 384-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xterm package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '384-1ubuntu1').
